definition: to attend a meeting (and hear what is discussed)
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: Sign language service will also be provided at the public hearing.
sentences.chinese: 公听会亦会提供手语服务。

sentences.english: The meeting began and the listeners stopped talking.
sentences.chinese: 会议开始了，听会的人停止了说话。
希望明天的抢听会也会很欢乐。

sentences.english: Is it enough just to listen and speak?
sentences.chinese: 光会听会说汉语就完了吗？

definition: to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to understand (on hearing)/to catch (what is spoken)
to receive a radio signal/to make an audio recording/(of an auditorium etc) to have good acoustics/(vocal training, linguistics) ending (of a word or syllable)
unable to make sense of what one is hearing
speech sounds/pronunciation/colloquial (rather than literary) pronunciation of a Chinese character/phonetic/audio/voice/(Internet) to voice chat/voice message
tone deaf/unable to sing in tune
to listen to stories/to listen to performance of 說書|说书 storytelling
